item.title: Mounting OneDrive on Linux for a Native Feel
item.author: Morti
item.description: I recently switched to Linux full-time and one of the first hurdles was getting my cloud storage to feel native. I use OneDrive for a lot of stuff, and I wanted it to just be there in my file manager when I boot up my machine, Yes I know, on one hand you say good bye to Windows and on the other hand you are still using the services. I use OneDrive because my whole family needs Office and also a cloud storage, and I have to admit, that the family package is cheap ðŸ¤‘.
